metadata.title: CVE-2021-42008 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
The decode_data function in drivers/net/hamradio/6pack.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.13.13 has a slab out-of-bounds write. Input from a processthat has the CAP_NET_ADMIN capability can lead to root access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42008` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-161-generic - 4.15.0-161.169
linux-image-4.15.0-161-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-161.169
linux-image-4.15.0-161-lowlatency - 4.15.0-161.169
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-161-generic - 4.15.0-161.169
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-161-lowlatency - 4.15.0-161.169
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-89-generic - 5.4.0-89.100~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-89-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-89.100~18.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-89-lowlatency - 5.4.0-89.100~18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-161.169').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
